chapters.title: The Bitter Aftertaste
chapters.summary: Disgraced food critic Leo Vance, now a private chef, serves a wealthy tech mogul a forgotten medieval dish. Hours later, the client is found dead. Leo's past scandal makes him the police's first person of interest.
key_events: Leo prepares 'Swanne in Galentyne' (a spiced swan dish) for reclusive billionaire Arthur Finch.
Finch is ecstatic, claiming the dish unlocked a childhood memory.
Leo returns to his modest apartment, haunted by his fall from grace after a plagiarism scandal.
Detectives arrive at his door: Finch was poisoned, and Leo was the last to see him alive.
Leo notices a peculiar, floral scent on the recipe card he used—one he didn't add.
chapters.ending_hook: While being questioned, Leo receives a text from an unknown number: a photo of the same recipe card, with a single ingredient circled in red.

chapters.title: A Recipe for Suspicion
chapters.summary: Leo investigates the recipe's origin while a second client from his recent past is murdered. He realizes the killings are connected to the obscure dishes he cooked.
key_events: Leo digs through his medieval culinary texts, tracing the recipe to a 14th-century manuscript.
He learns a second former client, a philanthropist, has died after he served her 'Porpoise in Savory Sauce'.
Both deaths are ruled as sophisticated, untraceable poisonings.
Detective Mara Chen, leading the case, confronts Leo with his access and motive.
Leo discovers a cryptic marginal note in the manuscript about 'the feast of final judgment'.
chapters.ending_hook: A food delivery arrives at Leo's door containing a perfect replica of the porpoise dish—and a note that reads, 'You set the table. I merely clear it.'

chapters.title: The Ghost of Kitchens Past
chapters.summary: Leo seeks help from his only remaining friend, a historian, and profiles his recent clients to predict the next target.
key_events: Leo visits Dr. Elara Vance, his estranged sister and a medieval historian.
They identify the recipes as coming from 'The Sated Man's Grimoire,' a text rumored to be used by a guild of poisoners.
Leo lists his last six clients—all ultra-wealthy with controversial reputations.
He identifies a pattern: the killer strikes 48 hours after the meal.
The next potential target is shipping magnate Elias Thorn.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo arrives at Thorn's estate to warn him, only to find the man already enjoying the first course of the fated medieval meal, prepared by a 'gift' from a anonymous benefactor.

chapters.title: A Palate for Poison
chapters.summary: Leo attempts to intercept the meal at Thorn's estate, leading to a dangerous confrontation and a clue left by the killer.
key_events: Leo insists on tasting every dish, using his refined palate to detect anomalies.
He identifies a rare, toxic honey in the sauce, saving Thorn.
A chaotic kitchen fire erupts, seemingly set as a diversion.
In the aftermath, Leo finds a small, carved wooden token left among the spices—a chef's knife crossed with a bone.
Thorn, furious and scared, fires Leo and has him thrown out.
chapters.ending_hook: Detective Chen arrests Leo at the gate, citing new forensic evidence placing him at all three scenes. As he's put in the car, he sees a shadowy figure watching from the woods, holding a chef's knife.

chapters.title: Confessions in Codex
chapters.summary: In custody, Leo and Elara decode the killer's messages, realizing the murders are elaborate critiques of the victims' moral failures.
key_events: Elara visits Leo in jail with photocopies from the Grimoire.
Each murder recipe corresponds symbolically to the victim's sins (e.g., swan for vanity, porpoise for greed).
The killer is not just murdering but 'commenting' through cuisine.
Leo recalls a brilliant, obsessive culinary student from his critic days who was expelled for dangerous experiments.
Detective Chen, intrigued but skeptical, agrees to check the lead.
chapters.ending_hook: Chen returns, shaken: the student, Silas Gault, died in a fire years ago. But the case file includes a photo of Gault's prized possession—a carving of a knife crossed with a bone.

chapters.title: The Underground Feast
chapters.summary: Released due to lack of evidence, Leo goes underground to infiltrate a black-market gourmet club where he believes the killer finds both clients and inspiration.
key_events: Using old contacts, Leo gains entry to 'The Epicurean Cellar,' a secret dining club.
He hears whispers of a ghost chef called 'The Last Course' who takes commissions for the ultimate critique.
Leo samples a dish and recognizes the distinct, floral scent from the first crime scene.
He meets a nervous sommelier who offers information for protection.
They are discovered; the sommelier is later found dead, a poisoned glass of wine beside him.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo escapes the Cellar, but in his pocket finds a menu for a twelve-course meal, with the final course titled 'The Critic's Humiliation'—scheduled for the next night at a location to be revealed.

chapters.title: A Killer's Critique
chapters.summary: The killer makes direct contact, forcing Leo to participate in a macabre dinner game to save the next target's life.
key_events: Leo receives a live stream showing a bound client and a kitchen.
The killer, using a voice modulator, challenges Leo to identify the fatal ingredient in a prepared dish via video, using only description.
With Elara's help on historical poisons, Leo succeeds, and the client is freed.
The killer praises Leo's palate, calling him 'the only worthy judge.'
The killer reveals he chose Leo because his disgrace made him the perfect 'unwitting utensil.'
chapters.ending_hook: The stream ends with a challenge: "Find me before the final course. Your next clue is in the dish that ruined you." Leo realizes he must revisit his own scandalous past.

chapters.title: The Plagiarized Dish
chapters.summary: Leo re-investigates the plagiarism incident that ended his career, discovering Silas Gault's hidden role and the origins of the killer's obsession.
key_events: Leo digs into the recipe he was accused of stealing years prior.
He finds it was originally published in an obscure journal under a pseudonym.
Elara traces the pseudonym to Silas Gault, who submitted it while Leo was a judge for a culinary award.
Leo realizes he unknowingly praised Gault's work, then later published a similar dish as his own, sparking Gault's descent.
Gault faked his death to begin his long-game revenge on the corrupt culinary elite.
chapters.ending_hook: At his old office, Leo finds a hidden package containing Gault's original journal, filled with mad designs for deadly meals. The final entry is a reservation in Leo's name for 'The Last Course.'

chapters.title: Setting the Final Table
chapters.summary: Leo and Chen deduce the location of the final meal—a decommissioned luxury hotel—and set a trap, with Leo as the bait.
key_events: The journal clues point to the abandoned 'Grandeur Hotel,' where Leo once gave a legendary review.
Chen sets up a surveillance team, but the killer anticipates police involvement.
Leo enters the vast, decaying kitchen alone, as instructed.
He finds a fully set, elegant table for two in the ballroom.
Course after course is delivered via a dumbwaiter, each a perfected version of the meals from the murders.
chapters.ending_hook: The final course arrives. Under the cloche is not food, but a photo of Detective Chen, bound. A speaker crackles: "Your review, Mr. Vance. One word only. Choose: her life, or my capture."

chapters.title: The Last Course
chapters.summary: Face-to-face with Silas Gault, Leo must use his culinary wits in a final deadly tasting to save Chen and himself.
key_events: Gault reveals himself, a gaunt figure scarred by the fire he faked.
He explains his philosophy: he is 'correcting the palate of a corrupt world.'
He presents two glasses of wine: one poisoned, one safe. Leo must use his senses to choose.
Leo identifies the poison by a minuscule olfactory clue—the floral scent.
Enraged, Gault attacks, and a fight erupts in the kitchen.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo disarms Gault, but the killer flees into the hotel's labyrinthine basement, triggering a lockdown. The police storm in, finding Leo holding the knife, with Chen still missing.

chapters.title: The Souring Truth
chapters.summary: With Gault on the run, Leo pieces together the killer's endgame: a mass poisoning at the city's largest charity gala, targeting the entire elite.
key_events: From Gault's notes, Leo deduces the final target is not a person, but an event: the 'Harvest Gala.'
Gault has infiltrated the catering staff.
The planned weapon is 'Metheglin,' a spiced mead, laced with a slow-acting toxin.
Chen is found locked in a pantry, alive—Gault left her as a 'witness.'
Police are skeptical of Leo's theory, forcing him and Chen to act alone.
chapters.ending_hook: At the gala, Leo spots Gault across the crowded hall, dressed as a sommelier. He is moments away from pouring the first glasses of the doomed mead.

chapters.title: A Matter of Taste
chapters.summary: Leo confronts Gault at the gala in a public showdown, using his knowledge of flavor and showmanship to expose the killer and prevent the massacre.
key_events: Leo creates a scene, grabbing the microphone and accusing the sommelier.
He challenges Gault to a public tasting, betting his own life that he can identify the poisoned batch.
In front of the stunned crowd, Leo correctly singles out the tainted decanter by its faint, bitter finish.
Gault, exposed and triumphant in his notoriety, attempts to drink from the poison but is tackled by Chen.
Gault is arrested, whispering to Leo, "You finally wrote a worthy review."
chapters.ending_hook: Weeks later, Leo's name is cleared. He's offered his old critic job but declines. Instead, he and Elara open a small culinary detective agency, with a business card that reads: 'Vance & Vance: Discerning Truth, One Bite at a Time.'
